title: NDP 2026: Rehearsal Night Chaos
description: It's the combined rehearsal and 40,000 people just opened the app at once. The servers are struggling to keep up. Your team has to keep things running while the show goes on.

software-engineer.title: Emergency Speed Fix
software-engineer.instruction: The app is crawling. It takes 8 seconds to load anything and people are giving up. You've found three problems but only have time to fix one before the fireworks segment. Which do you tackle?
software-engineer.hint: Under pressure, the fastest fix that doesn't risk breaking other things is usually better than the perfect fix that takes too long.

options.label: Remember recent answers so the app doesn't have to ask the server every time. Fixes 60% of the slowness but some users might briefly see float facts that are a few minutes out of date.
Turn off the camera overlay and serve a simple text-only version. The app becomes instantly fast but loses its wow factor for this rehearsal.
Rewrite the slowest database searches to be more efficient. Takes longer to implement but permanently fixes the root cause.
Make users wait in a queue with a loading animation instead of getting error messages. Nobody gets instant results but nobody gets kicked out either.

data-scientist.title: Find Out What's Breaking
data-scientist.instruction: The monitoring screen is showing warnings everywhere. You need to run a proper investigation to figure out what's actually failing and why. Put these steps in the right order.
data-scientist.hint: Always look at the big picture first before zooming in. Start with what's already visible before digging for hidden clues.

items.label: Pull up the live dashboard showing server load, memory usage, and network traffic
Match the spike timing to specific parts of the app to pinpoint where things are breaking
Look through the error logs from the last 10 minutes to spot repeating patterns
Follow individual slow requests through the system to see exactly where time is being lost
Write up the findings with charts so the rest of the team can act on them

cloud-engineer.title: Scale Up the Servers
cloud-engineer.instruction: The setup currently has 4 servers, each comfortably handling about 10,000 users. But 40,000 users just showed up and more are joining. Based on the user count over the last 4 time windows (in thousands), how many servers do you need to spin up RIGHT NOW to handle the peak?
cloud-engineer.hint: Each server handles 10,000 users. Divide the peak user count by 10,000 and round up.
